intro: Clypeola jonthlaspi subsp. gaudinii, commonly known as the Gaudini's clypeola, is a flowering plant belonging to the Brassicaceae family. It is characterized by its small, white or pale yellow flowers that are typically arranged in racemes. The plant has hairy stems and leaves that are lance-shaped with serrated edges. It thrives in rocky or gravelly soils and is often found in alpine or subalpine regions. Due to its limited distribution, it is considered a rare and specialized species.
